result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis M. Czerp

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Scheduling conference on October 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexis M. Czerp in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Alexis M. Czerp. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Defendant reserves right to substitution. 
Offer deadline 08-05-2022.

10:59 am - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexis M. Czerp appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender. She has not seen a copy of the complaint yet.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-20-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery-dvo and criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-23-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with N.A.G. or any premises he may occupy.  Court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
